response: "{ \"title\": \"Median of a Row of Houses\", \"description\": \"You are given an integer array `houses` where each `houses[i]` represents the cost of painting the `ith` house. You also have an integer `k`. Write a function `median_price` that calculates the median price you should charge to maximize your profit.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef median_price(houses: list[int], k: int) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `houses` (list[int]): A list of integers where each integer represents the cost of painting a house.\\n- `k` (int): An integer representing the number of houses you can paint.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the median price you should charge to maximize your profit.\", \"code\": \"\\ndef median_price(houses: list[int], k: int) -> int:\\n    houses.sort()\\n    left, right = 0, len(houses) - 1\\n    while True:\\n        mid = (left + right) // 2\\n        count = sum(1 for i in range(min(mid+1, k), max(k-mid, 0)) if houses[i] <= houses[mid])\\n        if count > k // 2:\\n            right = mid - 1\\n        elif count < k // 2:\\n            left = mid + 1\\n        else:\\n            return houses[mid]\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert median_price([12, 5, 2, 23], 3) == 21\", \"assert median_price([4, 6, 8, 7], 3) == 7\", \"assert median_price([1, 100, 1, 1], 2) == 1\", \"assert median_price([10, 20, 30, 40], 2) == 20\"] }"
